Oh dearest friend, whose heart is gentle pure,  
I find myself in sorrow deep and grave.  
Thy natal day, a joyous, sweet allure,  
Did slip my mind as winds through branches wave.  

In humblest guise, I plead for thy pardon,  
For trust misplaced this day can ne'er restore.  
Mine own heart doth ache with guilt’s mighty burden,  
As sweet remorse knocks at my chamber door.  

Let not this fault cleave our bond entwined tight,  
Nor cast a shadow o’er our concord fair.  
For thee, my friend, art a beacon of light,  
Whose presence life doth verily repair.  

From this misdeed, wisdom henceforth I reap,  
Ne'er to forget the joy our friendship keep.
